{{Infobox_Broadcast | call_letters = WNIN| station_logo = [[File:WNIN Logo.png|200px]]| station_slogan = "Building A Better Tri-State, Together" | station_branding = | analog = | digital = 9 ([[very high frequency|VHF]])| other_chs = | affiliations = [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]]| network = | founded = | airdate = [[March 5]], [[1970]]| location = [[Evansville, Indiana]]| callsign_meaning = Channel '''NIN'''e| former_callsigns = | former_channel_numbers = Analog:
9 (1970-2009)
Digital: 12| owner = WNIN Tri-State Public Media, Inc.| sister_stations = [[WNIN-FM]]| former_affiliations = [[National Educational Television|NET]] (March-October 1970)| effective_radiated_power = 19 [[kilowatt|kW]] (digital)| HAAT = 304 [[metre|m]] (digital)| class = | facility_id = 67802| coordinates = {{coord|37|59|1|N|87|16|13|W|type:landmark_scale:2000|name=WNIN}}| homepage = [http://www.wnin.org/ www.wnin.org/]|}} '''WNIN''' is a public [[television station]] in [[Evansville, Indiana]], broadcasting locally on channel 9 as a [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]] member station. The station is owned by WNIN Tri-State Public Media, who also owns [[sister station]] [[WNIN-FM]], the local [[National Public Radio|NPR]] member station. WNIN signed on for the first time on [[1970 in television|March 5, 1970]]. After a few months as a member of [[National Educational Television]], it joined PBS in October. WNIN also programs and transmits two local cable channels: WNIN Learn (Cable 12) and WNIN Create (Cable 13). These channels are available on two local [[cable TV]] operators (Insight and WOW - Wide Open West). WNIN Learn airs local [[Government-access television]] (GATV) for Vanderburgh County and Evansville City government meetings produced off-site inside the Carpenter House via remote-controlled cameras located in the Vanderburgh County Civic Center. WNIN Learn also airs repeats of some [[PBS Kids]] programs. WNIN Create simulcasts the national PBS [[Create_(TV_network)|Create]] channel which features how-to, creative and cooking programs. Local programs produced by WNIN include "Lawmakers" and "Newsmakers" (hosted by [[Evansville Courier & Press]] editor Mizell Stewart III), "Tri-State FOCUS" (hosted by Cameron Kinzer), as well as various live debates and local documentaries. As of 2010, all local programming is available online via the station's implementation of the [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]] COVE platform. The station broadcasts from The Carpenter House in downtown Evansville, which is on the [[United States]] [[National Register of Historic Places]]. David Dial is the general manager for WNIN. == Digital television == The station's digital channel is multiplexed: {| class="wikitable" '''Digital channel''' |- ! Channel ! Signal Type ! Name ! Programming |- | 9.1 || HD || WNIN 9.1 PBS || [[Public Broadcasting System|PBS]] and Local Programming |- | 9.2 || SD || WNIN 9.2 Local || Government Meetings, Local Programs, Reruns of [[Public Broadcasting System|PBS]] Programs, and Indiana Channel |- | 9.3 || SD || WNIN-SD || [[WNIN-FM]] Radio Simulcast |} ===== Indiana Channel ===== WNIN is the programming hub of the Indiana Public Broadcasting Stations (IPBS) project, the "Indiana Channel". Currently the "Indiana Channel" runs on 9.2 WNIN Local from 5-7 every weekday. ==External links== *[http://www.wnin.org/ Official site] *{{TVQ|WNIN}} *{{BIA|WNIN|TV|TV}} {{Evansville TV}} {{PBS Indiana}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wnin (Tv)}} [[Category:Channel 9 digital TV stations in the United States]] [[Category:Television channels and stations established in 1970]] [[Category:Television stations in Evansville, Indiana|WNIN]] [[Category:Television stations in Indiana]] [[Category:Television stations in Kentucky]] [[Category:Television stations in Illinois]] [[Category:PBS member stations]]
